skills.title: Front-End
skills.description: The front end is what users see and interact with directly on a website. It involves designing the visual elements using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to create a user-friendly interface.

skills.title: Back-End
skills.description: The back end handles the server-side operations, managing data and processing requests. Back-end developers use languages like Python or PHP to ensure the website functions smoothly.

skills.title: UI & UX Design
skills.description: UI design focuses on creating visually appealing and intuitive interfaces. Designers work on the look and feel of the website, including layout, colors, and interactive elements.

skills.title: Webflow Development
skills.description: Web flow refers to how users navigate and interact with a website. It's about creating a smooth and logical user experience, ensuring visitors can easily find information and complete tasks.
